items.description:
A good ARCHITECTURE.md file helps developers understand how and where to make changes, whether they are new to a project or not.
Diagrams, source code maps, and discussing invariants and design decisions are essential.
This can also be a dedicated section of your README.md files.
Great use of graphics for visualisations and project structure. Includes a list of important principles for the project.
items.title: esbuild

items.description: Good use of high level diagrams to show the stack and its parts. Describes the main processes. Describes platform invariants.
items.title: Flutter Engine

items.description: Calls out design decisions.
items.title: GitLab

items.description: Calls out different types of components, provides searchable areas, calls out invariants of different components, and describes structure with diagrams.

items.title: Neovim

items.description: Describes the initialization process, calls out environment requirements.

items.description: Good use of high-level diagrams. Describes source organisation.

items.description: Embedding an animated gif in your README quickly demonstrates what your project does and catches the reader's eye. Here are a few programs that can help you quickly create gifs for your project:
More vivid colors than the rest, but still keeps size low.
